numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Young women tend to reach out to their parents more often than young men.
2. Women visit their parents in person about 5% more often than men.
3. Women reach out to their parents via text or phone or video chat more often than men.
4. The difference for text or phone or video chat is about 40%.
6. I wonder why women reach out to their parents more often than men.
7. There is an association between gender and fostering a relationship with parents.
8. The graph makes me wonder what causes this difference.
9. I wonder why the difference for face-to-face visits is smaller than the difference for texts or calls.
10. A relationship with a parent is important.
11. I normally assume that people place more emphasis on in-person visits.
12. This graph makes me think otherwise.
13. I identify as a young woman.
14. I do not live with my parents.
15. Therefore, I must make an effort to foster my relationship with my parents.
16. I update my life by calling my parents.
17. I update my life by texting my parents.
18. In-person visits are less frequent because of physical distance between our homes.
19. The headline is: Young Adults are Children Too- Reach Out to Your Parents!
